CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The PSC based on a terpolymer with the optimized T / 2T ratio of 7 : 3 showed a high J sc of 18.3 mA cm^-2 and a FF of 71.2% , thus resulting in an enhanced PCE up to 10.8% .

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Material Name" entities:

1. PSC (Polymer Solar Cell)
2. terpolymer (a type of polymer)
3. T (Tolerance)
4. 2T (Double Tolerance)
5. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! My apologies for the confusion earlier. Here are the entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material Name":

1. terpolymer
2. PSC (Polymer Solar Cell)

These are the only entities in the paragraph that refer directly to "Material Name".

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material Name", presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| terpolymer |
| PSC (Polymer Solar Cell) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The PSC based on a terpolymer with the optimized T / 2T ratio of 7 : 3 showed a high J sc of 18.3 mA cm^-2 and a FF of 71.2% , thus resulting in an enhanced PCE up to 10.8% .

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Name" entities:

1. PSC (Polymer Solar Cell)
2. T (Terpolymer)
3. T/2T ratio (T to 2T ratio)
4. Jsc (Short-circuit current density)
5. FF (Fill factor)
6. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Sure! Here are the relevant entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties:

1. T (Terpolymer)
2. T/2T ratio (T to 2T ratio)
3. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency)

These are the entities that clearly refer to material properties in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| T (Terpolymer) |
| T/2T ratio (T to 2T ratio) |
| PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The PSC based on a terpolymer with the optimized T / 2T ratio of 7 : 3 showed a high J sc of 18.3 mA cm^-2 and a FF of 71.2% , thus resulting in an enhanced PCE up to 10.8% .

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following entities can be identified as "Property Value" entities:

1. T: This represents the value of the parameter "T" in the terpolymer, which is optimized in the study.
2. 2T: This represents the value of the parameter "2T" in the terpolymer, which is also optimized in the study.
3. J sc: This represents the value of the current density (J) at a scan rate (sc) of 18.3 mA cm^-2.
4. FF: This represents the value of the fill factor (FF) of the terpolymer, which is calculated to be 71.2%.
5. PCE: This represents the value of the power conversion efficiency (PCE) of the terpolymer, which is calculated to be 10.8%.

Therefore, the "Property Value" entities in the paragraph are T, 2T, J sc, FF, and PCE.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Of course! Here are the entities that refer to the value of material properties in the paragraph:

1. T: This represents the value of the parameter "T" in the terpolymer, which is optimized in the study.
2. PCE: This represents the value of the power conversion efficiency (PCE) of the terpolymer, which is calculated to be 10.8%.

I apologize for any confusion, and I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to the value of material properties, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| T |
| PCE |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
